intro: Oldenlandia omahekensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian spiderling, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Its leaves are usually opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. Oldenlandia omahekensis is considered an endemic species, meaning it is found nowhere else in the world.
